People with poor vision would have to rely on alternative methods of communication such as text messaging, sign language, or speaking loudly to convey information.
They may also have to rely on other senses such as smell, touch, and hearing to navigate their environment.
People with poor vision may have to rely on technology such as audio guides or braille displays to access information.
They may have to rely on their sense of touch to navigate their environment and perform tasks such as cooking and cleaning.
People with poor vision may have to rely on their memory and recall of past experiences to navigate their environment and perform tasks.
